intro: Psychotria clivorum, commonly known as the cliff psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often growing on rocky slopes or in forest understories. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
